page.title: 02ROMAN WAY
page.content:
The Red Scar Industrial Estate is built on land which was on the Roman Route to Ribchester. The alternative name for the estate is the Roman Way.
Before the factories and offices were built, the land was subjected to an archeological investigation to discover the remains of the Roman Road. Clegg's Pit which is still there, but nowadays used for fishing, was used as a watering hole for the Romans on their way to their settlement at Ribchester.
Just behind the Crematorium are the remains of the Red Scar Hall which was built in a picturesque setting overlooking the meander of the River Ribble.
